channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DATAMONGO-834] Cannot refer to renamed grouped fields in pipeline in MongoTemplate
item.description:
The following query in mongo is as such:

db.auditErrorEvents.aggregate(
 
{"$group":{_id:{ "eventID" : "$event.eventID" , "appID" : "$event.appID" , "eventUID" : "$event.eventUID" , "osPlatform" : "$event.osPlatform" , "deviceType" : "$event.deviceType"}}},
 
 
 
{"$group":{_id:{ "eventID" : "$_id.eventID" , "appID" : "$_id.appID" , "osPlatform" : "$_id.osPlatform" , "deviceType" : "$_id.deviceType"}, "count" : { "$sum" : 1}}}
 
);

Basically this is a distinct count of a field eventUID with grouping eventID, appID, osPlatform, deviceType. The MongoTemplate does not allow me to refer to the first grouping.

template.aggregate(newAggregation(
 
group(from(field("eventID", "event.eventID"), field("appID", "event.appID"), field("eventUID", "event.eventUID"), field("osPlatform", "event.osPlatform"), field("deviceType", "event.deviceType"))),
 
group(from(field("eventID", "_id.eventID"), field("appID", "_id.appID"), field("osPlatform", "_id.osPlatform"), field("deviceType"))).count().as("count")), collectionName(), GroupedCount.class);
 

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid reference '_id.eventID'!
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.aggregation.ExposedFieldsAggregationOperationContext.getReference(ExposedFieldsAggregationOperationContext.java:78)
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.aggregation.ExposedFieldsAggregationOperationContext.getReference(ExposedFieldsAggregationOperationContext.java:62)
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.aggregation.GroupOperation.toDBObject(GroupOperation.java:300)
item.summary: Cannot refer to renamed grouped fields in pipeline in MongoTemplate

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: In Spring Data MongoDB you don't differentiate between synthetic and non-synthetic fields, hence you must not prefix the references with _id. This is also what the exception says. Simply leaving those away should do the trick.

I tried without the reference of _id, and have the same problem.

template.aggregate(newAggregation(
 
				group(from(field("eventID", "event.eventID"), field("appID", "event.appID"), field("eventUID", "event.eventUID"), field("osPlatform", "event.osPlatform"), field("deviceType", "event.deviceType"))),
 
				group(from(field("eventID"), field("appID"), field("osPlatform"), field("deviceType"))).count().as("count")), collectionName(), GroupedCount.class);

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid reference 'eventID'!
at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.aggregation.ExposedFieldsAggregationOperationContext.getReference(ExposedFieldsAggregationOperationContext.java:78)
at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.aggregation.ExposedFieldsAggregationOperationContext.getReference(ExposedFieldsAggregationOperationContext.java:62)
at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.aggregation.GroupOperation.toDBObject(GroupOperation.java:300)
Any chance you can show the domain types you're using?
I've attached some sample data. It's just plain JSON. Please let me know if you need anything else.

Hello,

I gave this a spin:

static class DataMongo834Record {
 
 
 
		DataMongo834Event event;
 
		DataMongo834Account account;
 
 
 
		public DataMongo834Record(DataMongo834Event event, DataMongo834Account account) {
 
			this.event = event;
 
			this.account = account;
 
		}
 
	}
 
 
 
	static class DataMongo834Event {
 
 
 
		String eventId;
 
		String appId;
 
		String eventUid;
 
		String osPlatform;
 
		String deviceType;
 
 
 
		public DataMongo834Event(String eventId, String appId, String eventUid, String osPlatform, String deviceType) {
 
			this.eventId = eventId;
 
			this.appId = appId;
 
			this.eventUid = eventUid;
 
			this.osPlatform = osPlatform;
 
			this.deviceType = deviceType;
 
		}
 
	}
 
 
 
	static class DataMongo834Account {
 
		String accountId;
 
 
 
		public DataMongo834Account(String accountId) {
 
			this.accountId = accountId;
 
		}
 
	}

The following:

	/**
 
	 * @see DATAMONGO-834
 
	 */
 
	@Test
 
	public void foo() throws Exception {
 
 
 
		mongoTemplate.dropCollection(DataMongo834Record.class);
 
 
 
		mongoTemplate.insert(new DataMongo834Record(new DataMongo834Event("eventId1", "appId1", "eventUid1", "osPlatform1",
 
				"deviceType1"), new DataMongo834Account("accountId1")));
 
		mongoTemplate.insert(new DataMongo834Record(new DataMongo834Event("eventId1", "appId1", "eventUid1", "osPlatform1",
 
				"deviceType1"), new DataMongo834Account("accountId1")));
 
		mongoTemplate.insert(new DataMongo834Record(new DataMongo834Event("eventId1", "appId1", "eventUid2", "osPlatform2",
 
				"deviceType1"), new DataMongo834Account("accountId2")));
 
 
 
		AggregationResults<DBObject> result = mongoTemplate.aggregate(newAggregation( //
 
				group("event.eventId", "event.appId", "event.eventUid", "event.osPlatform", "event.deviceType").count().as(
 
						"count") //
 
				), DataMongo834Record.class, DBObject.class);
 
 
 
		System.out.println(result.getMappedResults());
 
	}

Gives:

[{ "eventId" : "eventId1" , "appId" : "appId1" , "eventUid" : "eventUid2" , "osPlatform" : "osPlatform2" , "deviceType" : "deviceType1" , "count" : 1}
 
, { "eventId" : "eventId1" , "appId" : "appId1" , "eventUid" : "eventUid1" , "osPlatform" : "osPlatform1" , "deviceType" : "deviceType1" , "count" : 2}]

Is this what you are looking for?

Cheers,
Thomas

Not exactly...

In my data I have 

{ "event": { "eventID": 1, "appID": 1, "eventUID": "EFF6DD20-ADF6-11E3-A5E2-0800200C9A66", "osPlatform": "windows", "deviceType": "tablet"} , "account": {"accountId": 123 } }
 
{ "event": { "eventID": 1, "appID": 1, "eventUID": "EFF6DD20-ADF6-11E3-A5E2-0800200C9A66", "osPlatform": "windows", "deviceType": "tablet"} , "account": {"accountId": 123 } }
 
{ "event": { "eventID": 1, "appID": 1, "eventUID": "AWEDD20-ADF6-11E3-A5E2-0800200C9BCC", "osPlatform": "windows", "deviceType": "android"} , "account": {"accountId": 321 } }

I want to have a count grouped by eventID, appID, osPlatform, deviceType, uniquely counted by eventUID.

This was the code I executed:

mongoTemplate.aggregate(newAggregation(
 
group(from(field("eventID", "event.eventID"), field("appID", "event.appID"), field("eventUID", "event.eventUID"), field("osPlatform", "event.osPlatform"), field("deviceType", "event.deviceType"))),
 
group(from(field("eventID", "_id.eventID"), field("appID", "_id.appID"), field("osPlatform", "_id.osPlatform"), field("deviceType"))).count().as("count")), collectionName(), GroupedCount.class);

The first grouping should produce:

[{ "eventID": 1, "appID": 1, "eventUID": "EFF6DD20-ADF6-11E3-A5E2-0800200C9A66", "osPlatform": "windows", "deviceType": "tablet" , "count": 1 },
 
{ "eventID": 1, "appID": 1, "eventUID": "AWEDD20-ADF6-11E3-A5E2-0800200C9BCC", "osPlatform": "windows", "deviceType": "android" , "count": 1 }]

The second grouping produces

[{ "eventID": 1, "appID": 1, "osPlatform": "windows", "deviceType": "tablet" , "count": 1 },
 
{ "eventID": 1, "appID": 1, "osPlatform": "windows", "deviceType": "android" , "count": 1 }]

Effectively this is the mongo equivalent of performing the following query in SQL:
Select count(distinct eventUID), eventId, appId, osPlatform, deviceType from table group by eventId, appId, osPlatform, deviceType;

Hi Christine,

thanks for the quick response

So you just leave the eventUid out in the second grouping, right?

	@Test
 
	public void foo() throws Exception {
 
 
 
		mongoTemplate.dropCollection(DataMongo834Record.class);
 
 
 
		mongoTemplate.insert(new DataMongo834Record(new DataMongo834Event("eventId1", "appId1", "eventUid1", "osPlatform1",
 
				"deviceType1"), new DataMongo834Account("accountId1")));
 
		mongoTemplate.insert(new DataMongo834Record(new DataMongo834Event("eventId1", "appId1", "eventUid1", "osPlatform1",
 
				"deviceType1"), new DataMongo834Account("accountId1")));
 
		mongoTemplate.insert(new DataMongo834Record(new DataMongo834Event("eventId1", "appId1", "eventUid2", "osPlatform1",
 
				"deviceType1"), new DataMongo834Account("accountId2")));
 
 
 
		AggregationResults<DBObject> result = mongoTemplate.aggregate(newAggregation(//
 
				group("event.eventId", "event.appId", "event.eventUid", "event.osPlatform", "event.deviceType"),//
 
				group("eventId", "appId", "osPlatform", "deviceType").count().as("count")), //
 
				DataMongo834Record.class, DBObject.class);
 
 
 
		System.out.println(result.getMappedResults());
 
	}

Gives:

[{ "eventId" : "eventId1" , "appId" : "appId1" , "osPlatform" : "osPlatform1" , "deviceType" : "deviceType1" , "count" : 2}]

Or did I miss something?

Cheers,
Thomas

Correct.

In version 1.3.3 I got an exception

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid reference 'eventID'!
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.aggregation.ExposedFieldsAggregationOperationContext.getReference(ExposedFieldsAggregationOperationContext.java:78)
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.aggregation.ExposedFieldsAggregationOperationContext.getReference(ExposedFieldsAggregationOperationContext.java:62)

when I performed the same query.

Looks like you got it working now.
